page.title: 01INTRODUCING WINTERINGHAM
page.content: A rural area in North West Lincoln- shire until reorganization of Local Government in 1974 when the County of Humberside was formed.The River Humber forms part of the northern boundary with the nucleus of the village situa- ted to the West of the region.Part of Reads Island, a silt deposit in the River Humber, is included. The present village of Winteringham is just to the West of the Ermine Street and Roman Ad Abum. Much evid- ence of Roman settlement has been found. Saxons and Vikings also influ- enced settlement in this area. A rich fertile agricultural region with most of the land growing cereals and root crops. With a population of 850, it is a residential village for Scunthorpe or Hull. A good community spirit with pubs, clubs and societies to suit all ages.
